name: Kozhikode Beach
description: Popular beach for sunset views and street food.

name: Paragon Restaurant
description: Famous for biryani and Malabar cuisine.

name: SM Street
description: Historic shopping street for sweets and textiles.

name: Hotel Rahmath
description: Popular for beef biryani and milk sarbath. Beloved for its Kozhikode‑style biryani and cozy ambiance.

name: Mishkal Mosque (Mithqal Palli)
description: Built in the 14th century by a wealthy Arab trader, this medieval mosque is a prime example of Kerala-Islamic architecture with four tiers, 47 doors, 24 wooden pillars, and a large prayer hall.

name: Tali Shiva Temple (Tali Mahakshetram)
description: Ancient Shiva temple built in the 14th century by the Zamorins. Features chariot-shaped sanctum, murals, granite sculptures, and hosts the annual Revathi Pattathanam festival.

name: Mananchira Square & Tank
description: A 14th‑century freshwater tank and landscaped public park, originally built by Zamorin Mana Vikrama. The nearby Town Hall (1891) blends colonial and Kerala styles.

name: Pazhassi Raja Archaeological Museum & Art Gallery
description: Located in the East Hill Bungalow (built 1812), this museum preserves artefacts from 1000 BC to 200 AD, including megaliths, coins, bronzes, and works by Raja Ravi Varma.

name: Kappad Beach (Kappakadavu)
description: Historic site where Vasco da Gama landed in 1498. A stone memorial marks this event, making it a key gateway to the Malabar coast.

name: Focus Mall
description: First shopping mall in Kozhikode. Offers branded stores, a food court, and PVR cinemas.

name: HiLITE Mall
description: Largest mall in Calicut with top fashion brands, restaurants, Hypermarket, INOX, and indoor entertainment.

name: RP Mall
description: Medium-sized mall with retail stores, restaurants, and Cinepolis multiplex.

name: Gazania Mezban Restaurant
description: Authentic Malabar dishes with a fusion twist. Highly praised in local blogs alongside Paragon & Rahmath.
location: Mavoor Rd / MG Rd — search 'Gazania Mezban Kozhikode' on Maps
